ayah: By the dawn
And [by] ten nights[1913]
footnotes: [1913] Usually interpreted as the first ten nights of the month of Dhul-Ḥijjah.

ayah: And [by] the even [number] and the odd
And [by] the night when it passes,
Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?[1914]
footnotes: [1914] Based upon the following verses, what has been sworn to by Allāh is that He will certainly punish the disbelievers.

ayah: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
[With] Iram[1915] - who had lofty pillars,[1916]
footnotes:
[1915] Another name for the first people of ʿAad, to whom Prophet Hūd was sent.
[1916] Supporting their tents or buildings.

ayah: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?[1917]
[All of] whom oppressed within the lands
And increased therein the corruption.
So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
Indeed, your Lord is in observation.
And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."[1918]
footnotes: [1918] He is proud rather than grateful, attributing the favor to his own merit.

ayah: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
No![1919] But you do not honor the orphan
footnotes: [1919] It is not like you imagine. Rather, Allāh tries people through prosperity and hardship and rewards both gratitude and patience with honor in the Hereafter.

ayah: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,[1920]
footnotes: [1920] Not caring whether it is lawful or unlawful.

ayah: And you love wealth with immense love.
No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed
And your Lord has come[1921] and the angels, rank upon rank,
footnotes: [1921] To pass judgement. See footnote to 2:19.

ayah: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?
He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."[1922]
footnotes: [1922] The everlasting life of the Hereafter.

ayah: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
[To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants
And enter My Paradise."
